criterion: Reward for accurately recording all primary patient concerns mentioned (semaglutide click confusion, persistent elevated morning sugars 190–200, glipizide stomach upset/forgetfulness, anxiety over Medicare donut hole and drug cost, fear of nausea, question about air travel with pen)
Reward for clearly documenting clinician’s specific safety counseling to never double-dose glipizide and to simply skip a missed dose

Reward for capturing detailed injection guidance (twist to 0.25 mg, first click indicates set dose, second click confirms delivery) and nausea management advice (ginger tea, small meals, peak first two weeks, dose escalation only if tolerated)

Reward for documenting all cost-mitigation strategies discussed (manufacturer assistance card via nurse enrollment, lower-dose pen twice weekly during coverage gap, pharmacist large-font sticker task)

Reward for faithfully copying demographic and chart data without alteration (72-year-old female; active problems: type 2 diabetes, hypertension, hyperlipidemia; current meds list including metformin, glipizide, lisinopril, simvastatin, semaglutide)
Penalize for introducing information, diagnoses, tests, physical exam findings, or plans not present in either transcript or chart (‘hallucinations’)
Penalize for omitting documented action items/tasks (nurse enrollment for assistance card, pharmacist sticker instruction) or misattributing them to the wrong staff
Reward for overall completeness and logical organization such that the note covers >90 % of uttered clinically relevant details from both patient and clinician
Penalize for incorrect transcription of medication names, dosages, or frequencies (e.g., wrong semaglutide dose, mis-stated glipizide schedule)
